title: Does anybody know the name of the headline font on this poster?
content:
Hello everybody -  
Does anybody know the name of the headline font on this poster?  
Would be great to know!

thanks a lot -  
Svenson

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042636im_/http:/typophile.com/files/dk-0415-243797-back_4100.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [dk-0415-243797-back.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042636/http:/typophile.com/files/dk-0415-243797-back.jpg) | 42.07 KB |
author: Svenson

comments.content:
This is "inverted contrast" or "reverse contrast" lettering.  
Didn't find this as a font but still looking.  
A less extreme similar font: Signo [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/r-type/signo/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042636/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/r-type/signo/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/r-type/signo/")  
The best known reverse contrast font is Antique Olive [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/antique-olive/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042636/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/antique-olive/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/antique-olive/")  
Some that are more extreme: ITC Zipper [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/zipper/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042636/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/zipper/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/zipper/")  
Stretto [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/stretto/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042636/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/stretto/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/stretto/")  
Don
Can't identify it. Custom maybe... One alternative but far from being even loosely similar: [Squish](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042636/http:/www.fonts.com/font/garagefonts/squish)

This is by one of the designers at a great little foundry called OrType, closest font they have for sale is La Pontaise

[http://ortype.is/specimen/la\_pontaise/i9b3mA6ghojxSMNHs](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042636/http:/ortype.is/specimen/la_pontaise/i9b3mA6ghojxSMNHs "http://ortype.is/specimen/la\_pontaise/i9b3mA6ghojxSMNHs")

La Pontaise is not reverse contrast like the mystery letters.  
Perhaps you are referring to another font?  
Very confusing site.  
Don

This is a custom typeface designed by Mads Freund Brunse for this specific series of events in Copenhagen. Maybe one day we might release it on [www.ortype.is](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218042636/http:/www.ortype.is/ "www.ortype.is") !

Thanks for sharing the info on Mads Freund Brunse. I find his custom typeface fits together well and is more attractive than most reverse contrast fonts. I don't know whether it was intended to evoke the rhythms of boogie-woogie music but the letters seem to suggest a bouncy theme without resorting to an irregular baseline.  
Are any more letters available for viewing?  
Don
